title: The 2025 Core77 Design Awards Visual Communication Winners
description: The 2025 Professional winner in the Visual Communication is Wayfinding Way Better: Metro's Wayfinding Improvements by the WMATA Team and including Jacobs Engineering, Entro, Order NYC, Joseph Chan, Ray Yau, Daron Showalter, Tom Proctor, Nick Palastro, and Brian Anderson. Metro refreshed its wayfinding and digital information systems to unify and elevate the customer experience through thoughtful design, better data, and contextual awareness. It brought together data, design, software, and human insights to create a more seamless journey.The Student Visual Communication winner is Incomplete Encyclopedia of Memory by Kyoki Takahashi at ArtCenter College of Design. This book explores memory from two perspectives: one that thinks, and one that feels. Designed as an "Incomplete Encyclopedia of Memory, the book is divided into two parts: one side explores memory from a logical perspective, while the other delves into the sensory and emotional aspects. The jury team for the Visual Communication category was led by Jury Captain YanYan Zhang, an Associate Partner and Executive Creative Director at VSA Partners. Zhang put together a jury which includes Kelly Bjork, a Partner at IDEO, Michael Braley, the Creative Director at Braley Design, and Liz Oh, a Senior UX Design Manager at HubSpot.The 2025 Visual Communication category includes all visual and graphic design, branding and identity projects for print, digital or physical environments such as logos and identity systems, environmental graphics, signage, typefaces, infographics, motion graphics, print design, and advertising. html:
The 2025 Core77 Design Awards Visual Communication Winners

The Visual Communication jury was led by YanYan Zhang an Associate Partner & Executive Creative Director, VSA Partners

The 2025 Professional winner in the Visual Communication is Wayfinding Way Better: Metro's Wayfinding Improvements by the WMATA Team and including Jacobs Engineering, Entro, Order NYC, Joseph Chan, Ray Yau, Daron Showalter, Tom Proctor, Nick Palastro, and Brian Anderson. Metro refreshed its wayfinding and digital information systems to unify and elevate the customer experience through thoughtful design, better data, and contextual awareness. It brought together data, design, software, and human insights to create a more seamless journey.

The Student Visual Communication winner is Incomplete Encyclopedia of Memory by Kyoki Takahashi at ArtCenter College of Design. This book explores memory from two perspectives: one that thinks, and one that feels. Designed as an "Incomplete Encyclopedia of Memory, the book is divided into two parts: one side explores memory from a logical perspective, while the other delves into the sensory and emotional aspects.

The jury team for the Visual Communication category was led by Jury Captain YanYan Zhang, an Associate Partner and Executive Creative Director at VSA Partners. Zhang put together a jury which includes Kelly Bjork, a Partner at IDEO, Michael Braley, the Creative Director at Braley Design, and Liz Oh, a Senior UX Design Manager at HubSpot.

The 2025 Visual Communication category includes all visual and graphic design, branding and identity projects for print, digital or physical environments such as logos and identity systems, environmental graphics, signage, typefaces, infographics, motion graphics, print design, and advertising.

Visual Communication Award Honorees

  • Pro Winner

    Wayfinding Way Better: Metro's Wayfinding Improvements

  • Student Winner

    Incomplete Encyclopedia of Memory

    By Kyoko Takahashi

  • Student Runner Up

    Color Catcher

  • Student Runner Up
